Compute the sex of the individuals

Source: R/addDemographics.R
addSex.Rd

Compute the sex of the individuals

Usage

addSex(x, sexName = "sex", missingSexValue = "None", name = NULL)

Arguments

x

Table with individuals in the cdm.

sexName

name of the new column to be added.

missingSexValue

Value to include if missing sex.

name

Name of the new table, if NULL a temporary table is returned.

Value

table x with the added column with sex information.

Examples

# \donttest{
cdm <- mockPatientProfiles()
cdm$cohort1 %>%
  addSex()
#> # Source:   table<og_116_1718095191> [10 x 5]
#> # Database: DuckDB v0.10.2 [unknown@Linux 6.5.0-1021-azure:R 4.4.0/:memory:]
#>    cohort_definition_id subject_id cohort_start_date cohort_end_date sex   
#>                   <int>      <int> <date>            <date>          <chr> 
#>  1                    2          7 2029-11-03        2037-04-05      Female
#>  2                    2          8 1983-08-16        2017-04-07      Male  
#>  3                    1          3 2074-06-05        2095-09-12      Female
#>  4                    2          2 2137-09-21        2181-09-21      Female
#>  5                    2          9 2010-09-28        2019-10-12      Female
#>  6                    3          4 2032-09-03        2054-10-28      Male  
#>  7                    1          1 1962-12-14        1987-05-15      Female
#>  8                    3          5 2029-02-22        2030-07-10      Male  
#>  9                    1         10 2010-08-16        2012-02-01      Female
#> 10                    1          6 1908-06-14        1930-05-28      Female
mockDisconnect(cdm = cdm)
# }
